docs.snippet: LEAD: Last July, Richard Shaw watched the National Hot Rod Association Summernational drag races in Old Bridge, N.J., from the grandstands. Earlier this month, the 30-year-old fashion industry executive had a different perspective on the action at...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Last July, Richard Shaw watched the National Hot Rod Association Summernational drag races in Old Bridge, N.J., from the grandstands. Earlier this month, the 30-year-old fashion industry executive had a different perspective on the action at the Winternational event at Pomona, Calif. Shaw watched it from behind the canopy of an 800-horsepower gas dragster, as he became the first winner in a new race series that permits drivers to rent rides rather than entering their own cars.

docs.snippet: LEAD: In Guatemala, where thousands of people have died in political violence during the 1980's, human rights advocates have never been popular. So the creation last year of an independent agency empowered to denounce any and all abuses aroused co...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: In Guatemala, where thousands of people have died in political violence during the 1980's, human rights advocates have never been popular. So the creation last year of an independent agency empowered to denounce any and all abuses aroused considerable curiosity and even some hope.

headline.main: In Guatemala, Growing Pessimism on Human Rights Issues

byline.original: By STEPHEN KINZER, Special to the New York Times
